2.1. Introduction¶

This is an introduction to some basic HTML tags which will help to start.

We will write Hello World in this section.

2.1.1. DOCTYPE Declaration¶

  1. The <!DOCTYPE> declaration must be the first thing in any HTML document.
  2. Do not confuse it it as a HTML tag.
  3. It is an instruction to the web browser about what version of HTML the page is written.
  4. This declaration is not case senstive

<!DOCTYPE html>

2.1.2. Elements and Attributes¶

  1. Elements are written within a start tag, and an end tag, with the content in between.

<tagname> content </tagname>

  1. Some elements do not have an end tag, like <br>, <hr>.
  2. Attributes provide additional information about an element.
  3. This is always specified in the start tag.
  4. Attributes come in name/value pairs like : name="value"

2.1.3. HTML Tag¶

  1. The`` <html>`` tag tells the browser that this is an HTML document.
  2. It is the container of all other HTML elements.
  3. To end the <html> tag we put a **"\"** before the tag : ``</html>

<html> ..... </html>

2.1.4. HEAD Tag¶

  1. The <head> element is a container for all the head elements.
  2. It can include a title for the document, scripts, styles, meta information, links and more.
  3. It is optional in case of HTML5 (if there are no scripts or styles or links).

<head> ..... </head>

2.1.5. TITLE Tag¶

  1. Every web page has a title which is shown in the window tab of browser.
  2. <title> tag is used to define the same.
  3. As mentioned above, it is enclosed within the <html> tag.

<title> First Page </title>

2.1.6. BODY Tag¶

  1. The <body> tag defines the documents body.
  2. It contains all the text, images and data which needs to be displayed on the webpage.
  3. It also needs a closing tab to end the body section of the webpage.
  4. This tag is outside the <head> tag but inside <html> tag.

<body> ......... </body>

2.1.7. Adding comments¶

  1. It is very necessary to add comments in your code to imporove the readibility.
  2. Having comments in the code, make it easy to traverse through and understand the spicific on any code piece within.
  3. In HTML we add comments using <!-- Your Comments -->

2.1.8. Example 1¶

  1. This is the code to have a page with Hello World

<!DOCTYPE html>

<html>
<head>
<title> First Example </title>
</head>

<body>
<!--Text need to be displyed goes inside the <body> -->
        Hello World

<footer>
        <p>&copy www.crestrou.com</p>
</footer>

</body>
</html>
